subject: Programming
title: The Patriot Missile Clock Drift
description: A 60-second lesson on The Patriot Missile Clock Drift.

hook.text: In 1991, a Patriot missile battery failed to intercept an incoming Scud. Twenty-eight soldiers died.

buildup.text: The system's internal clock measured time in tenths of seconds using a 24-bit register.

discovery.text: A tiny rounding error of 0.000000095 seconds accumulated over 100 hours of operation.

twist.text: After 100 hours, the clock had drifted by a third of a second â€” enough to miss a Scud.

climax.text: The Army knew about the bug and issued a patch, but it arrived one day too late.

punchline.text: A rounding error of a billionth cost 28 lives.

quiz.question: What caused the Patriot missile system to fail?
options: Accumulated clock drift from rounding errors
